DataElement.preferredName: In Situ Hybridization DNA Probe Exact Display Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name that describes how the specificity of the probe was displayed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues_A piece of DNA that has been labeled, usually radioactively or with a fluorescent dye, which is used in hybridization studies.  Applications include Northern and Southern blots, in situ hybridization techniques, and diagnostic tests.  DNA probes can be highly specific or degenerate.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues

Concepts.definition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues.

Property.preferredDefinition: A piece of DNA that has been labeled, usually radioactively or with a fluorescent dye, which is used in hybridization studies.  Applications include Northern and Southern blots, in situ hybridization techniques, and diagnostic tests.  DNA probes can be highly specific or degenerate.

Concepts.definition: A piece of DNA that has been labeled, usually radioactively or with a fluorescent dye, which is used in hybridization studies.  Applications include Northern and Southern blots, in situ hybridization techniques, and diagnostic tests.  DNA probes can be highly specific or degenerate.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The name that describes how the probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI): Arrangement of chromosomes in the equatorial plane of the central spindle to form the monaster.  Chromosomes separate into exactly similar halves. (NCI): (LO-kal-ih-ZAY-shun) The process of determining or marking the location or site of a lesion or disease. May also refer to the process of keeping a lesion or disease in a specific location or site.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The second phase of mitosis, in which the chromosomes line up across the equatorial plane of the spindle prior to separation.
The process of determining or marking the location or site of a lesion or disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Marked by strict and particular and complete accordance with fact.:Display; exhibiting openly in public view; a visual representation of something.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.
Marked by strict and particular and complete accordance with fact.
Exhibit, present, or demonstrate for viewing.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
